TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AppWinStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates the window style to use for the invoked program when calling the function.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you issue `Shell` commands, you can use the following enumeration members in your code in place of the actual values.
The `Style` argument takes the `AppWinStyle` enumeration members.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AppWinStyle Hide = int16(0)

Docs.summary: Window is hidden and focus is passed to the hidden window. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AppWinStyle MaximizedFocus = int16(3)

Docs.summary: Window is maximized with focus. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AppWinStyle MinimizedFocus = int16(2)

Docs.summary: Window is displayed as an icon with focus. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AppWinStyle MinimizedNoFocus = int16(6)

Docs.summary: Window is displayed as an icon. The currently active window remains active. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AppWinStyle NormalFocus = int16(1)

Docs.summary: Window has focus and is restored to its original size and position. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.AppWinStyle NormalNoFocus = int16(4)

Docs.summary: Window is restored to its most recent size and position. The currently active window remains active. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant .
